page.title: 13MEMORIES OF RAWTHORPE 1
page.content: We remember-when we,Mrs.Wright and Mrs.Leng,moved to Rawthorpe Lane our houses were in the countryside.There were{open fields all around,stretching {down to Kirkheaton, the only buildings being large,Millowners houses,small cottages,our terrace houses and farms.The only shop,on the corner of Dalton Fold,was owned by Mrs. Tinker."she were a right tinker an'all!"The road was{cobbled}and tarmac with a{wellflattened earth {footpath.}Coal,meat,bread and milk were delivered by lorry or van,the greengrocer had a{horse and cart.} About 1955 Rawthorpe High School was built,followed by the Infants and Juniors.In 1945'6{german prisoners of {war}built a series of roads in the fields to the east of Rawthorpe Lane,the forerunners of the big Dalton estate of today.
